p.k: Congo, a new deal for the forest
p.d: Overexploitation, deforestation and the eradication of native peoples... Just like its Amazonian cousin, central Africa's tropical forest is suffering. Congo-Brazzaville, a country in this region, is fighting to save its forests. Today praised by NGOs worldwide, the Congolese example shows that another form of forestry is possible and even profitable. Director: Gil KebaIli (France, 2016)
